titles.title: Parental Rights Protection Act of 2001
To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide penalties for the enticement of children which interferes with parental authority.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 7/24/2001--Introduced. Parental Rights Protection Act of 2001 - Amends the Federal criminal code to prohibit anyone 18 or older from using any instrumentality of communication that affects interstate or foreign commerce to intentionally entice a child to run away from home and thereby interfere with the parental rights of another person.
